page.title: 11Amenities in Strensall
page.content: Strensall is well provided for generally, having sufficient shops, doctors and a dentist. Older people and families without cars rely upon the{village amenities,}the bus fare to York being expensive (85p each way adult fare). A survey of over 60 villagers showed that people are happy with the amenities. {Further amenities people would like included a chemist's shop (5 people) and a bank (4 people). Other{desirable amenities}mentioned are a hardware store and various recreational facilities, but these were only mentioned by one or two people. The village's greatest {deficiency}does lie in the area of {recreation provision.} The amenities used most by the people surveyed were the post office, food shops and doctors', being mentioned by more than half of those interviewed.
